page.title: 06THE ARCHBISHOP'S SCHOOL
page.content: {State} Founded by Archbishop Fisher 1958.Religious bias:C/E.{Fees} none. {Staff}32 {Pupils}:600(mixed){Ages}11- 17.{Courses}"O"Levels 100 "C.S.E" 120 Subjects:20(including computing) {Facilities}Sports:Gym.,fields,5 tennis courts.Leisure:Electronics,community service,choirs,band,computer club,chess photography,Duke of Edinburgh awards. {Uniform}navy blue,white/grey. {Pupil Rachel}"When the first bell goes we enter the classroom for registration.After that,we go to the hall for a twenty minute assembly, consisting of a hymn,reading and prayer." {Visitor Charlotte}:"There were lots of computers.They had a white board instead of a blackboard,because otherwise they would get dust in the computers...Another teacher told us the pupils learn to make things of iron and steel."
